documents.title: tube prank man fined over broken back
text: an

frans bekker , 51 , lost control and fell down the escalator at london 's holborn station colliding with a number of people , including linda soulsby , who suffered a fractured vertebra , westminster magistrates ' court heard .
bekker pleaded guilty to endangering the safety of a person conveyed by railway at an earlier hearing .

documents.title: no.10 gardeners balloted over strike action
text: workers who maintain and clean royal parks in london and the gardens at 10 and 11 downing street are to be balloted for strikes in a row over pay .
members of the
the gmb warned that any action could hit events such as the state opening of parliament and trooping the colour .

documents.title: council 'spends £ 90m buying back homes '
text: the mirror reports that
the council has bought back 295 ex-council homes at an average cost of £ 307,593 - up to 22 times more than they were sold for .
author: The Mirror

documents.title: greaves faces 'long road to recovery '
text: former england and tottenham striker
the 75-year-old , who is fourth on the list of all-time england goalscorers , is `` conscious but unable to speak '' , his agent terry baker added .

documents.title: jurors deliberate on further sex charges
text: more on the conviction of army recruitment sergeant edwin mee at southwark crown court for sex attacks on female cadets .
the jury , who retired to consider their verdicts a week ago , are continuing to deliberate on four counts of sexual assault and one of rape .

documents.title: female cadets raped by mee
text: the court heard mee
he was convicted of 10 sexual assaults , two rapes and one count of assault by penetration .
he was found not guilty of three counts of sexual assault .

documents.title: mee exploited position of trust
text: mee , 46 , of tavistock road , croydon was accused of exploiting his position of trust and power to abuse women while working at army offices in croydon .
he had denied all the allegations against him .

documents.title: breakingarmy recruitment officer guilty of sex attacks
text: army recruitment sergeant edwin mee , 46 , has been found guilty at southwark crown court of 13 sex attacks on seven female recruits .
jurors acquitted him of three offences and are still considering others .
author: BREAKING NEWS

documents.title: watch : street art in fitzrovia
text: the works will stay in place for the next five years , unless nature takes its toll or if there is a change of infrastructure .

documents.title: two injured in river thames wall fall
text: a man was rescued by the
lifeboat helmsman mick neil said : 'it appeared two men were on a night out when one of them went over the handrail and fell about 25ft onto the exposed river foreshore below .
`` his friend then slid down the vertical river wall in an attempt to help him , suffering cuts , bruises and an injury to his ankle . ''
both men were rescued , despite the tide coming in , and taken to hospital .

documents.title: what happens when fire destroys stately homes ?
text: after clandon park house in surrey was gutted by fire last week i 've looked at

at hampton court in 1986 a fire swept through the historic building after starting in the `` grace and favour '' apartment of 86-year-old widow lady daphne gale , who unfortunately died in the blaze .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: queen visits princess charlotte
text: the
the princess , who is fourth in line to the throne , was born on saturday at london 's st mary 's hospital , weighing 8lbs 3oz ( 3.7kg ) .

documents.title: terror police make airport arrests
text: four british men have been arrested at gatwick airport , by
the men had flown to turkey last week but were refused entry upon arrival and were flown back to the uk on saturday .
the men - aged 32 , 36 , 37 and 38 - have been bailed until mid-june , the met said .

documents.title: listen : artists ' 'shaking things up '
text: the ybas - or young british artists - emerged from art colleges in the 1990s and took the art world by storm after their work was bought up and marketed by charles saatchi .
the man who fostered much of this new talent was michael craig martin , a conceptual artist and painter who tutored aspiring artists at london 's goldsmiths college .
i spoke to him for the today programme , and looked back to
author: Will Gompertz
Arts editor

documents.title: moving banks
text: changing your bank account can seem a hassle in itself , but what about if you had to move an entire bank , as hsbc has hinted it may relocate its hq away from london .

some shareholders think a higher dividend would be available if the bank moved from london to a city with lower taxes and looser capital controls , but it also needs to find a stable business environment and preferably a location with clients and bankers to hire - so
author: Howard Mustoe
Business reporter

documents.title: hsbc move decision 'within months '
text: hsbc has said it will make its decision about whether to move its headquarters out of london
the bank said if it did move only 250 jobs out of the 48,000 uk-based hsbc employees would be transferred to the new location .
more details are set to be released on 9 june .

documents.title: ex-teacher pleads guilt to child sex offences
text: a former teacher at a private junior school in barnes has pleaded guilty to possessing and making thousands of indecent images of children .

anthony fuggle was the first person to be charged under the met 's operation winthorpe , which was set up to investigate allegations of abuse at st paul 's prep school and its junior school colet court where he taught classics .
he will be sentenced next month .

documents.title: houseboats clogging up london
text: we 're all aware of london 's housing crises , but according to the guardian , the
it reports that in hotspots such as hackney boat numbers have risen by 85 % in the past year alone with the number of houseboats across the capital increasing from 2,175 in 2007 to more than 3,000 .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: employee 'removed ' during pm visit
text: an employee at a twickenham garden centre was `` removed '' by security staff during a speech by david cameron after heckling the prime minister .

the scottish man , who gave his name as jonathan , said he was criticising the `` racism '' by tory candidate boris johnson whose use of phrases such as `` ajockalypse and tartan terror '' were `` demonising scots '' .
he said : `` the racism i am getting from these people and boris is unfair .
i wanted to give my democratic voice but i was jostled out '' .
author: Gareth Furby
BBC London reporter

documents.title: political amore
text: parties might get it on this friday as talk of coalitions and pacts continue , but here in bermondsey and old southwark there 's no `` amore '' between the lib dems & labour .
despite his 19 % majority simon hughes faces his toughest attack yet from labour with a challenge from neil coyle - a result that is too close to call .
author: Susana Mendonca
BBC London 94.9 political reporter

documents.title: how will mourinho handle 'tricky ' third season ?
text: ordinarily a manager should be allowed to bask a little after winning the premier league
for all the successes of this past season , the one ahead might yet be the defining period in mourinho 's second spell at chelsea .
never has he stayed at a club for more than three full seasons .
never before has the third year been quite as successful as the ones that preceded it .
so can
author: Tom Fordyce
Chief sports writer

documents.title: teenager critical after lewisham stabbing
text: a 16-year-old boy is in a critical condition after he was stabbed in a street fight in lewisham .
the
the teenager was found with stab injuries and was taken to a south london hospital where he remains in a critical condition .
a 17-year-old man was arrested on sus of violent disorder and is being held at a south london police station .

documents.title: blood test 'boost ' in ovarian cancer fight
text: regular blood tests can
the first results of the 14-year trial by university college london of more than 46,000 women suggest tumours can be detected early .
however , the researchers have warned that it is still unknown whether more lives were saved .
